qas.question: What country did Burke propose restricting trade with?
What city did Burke represent in parliament?
When did Burke make a motion to restrict Irish trade?
What was Bristol's most important industry?
What country did Burke wish to decrease trade with?
When was trade with Ireland originally restricted?

plausible_answers.text: his judgment assured him they were wrong

qas.question: Why did Burke say he acquiesced to his constituents?

context: In <a2_0><b6_0>May 1778<b6_0/><a2_0/>, Burke supported a parliamentary motion revising restrictions on Irish trade. His constituents, citizens of the great <a3_0>trading<a3_0/> city of <a1_0><b5_0>Bristol<b5_0/><a1_0/>, however urged Burke to oppose free trade with <a0_0><b4_0>Ireland<b4_0/><a0_0/>. Burke resisted their protestations and said: "If, from this conduct, I shall forfeit their suffrages at an ensuing election, it will stand on record an example to future representatives of the Commons of England, that one man at least had dared to resist the desires of his constituents when <b7_0>his judgment assured him they were wrong<b7_0/>".
